info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:42PM EDT until March 31 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MADISON...SOUTHWESTERN RAPPAHANNOCK...NORTHEASTERN GREENE AND SOUTHWESTERN CULPEPER COUNTIES... At 842 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Madison, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Madison, Brightwood, Criglersville, Slate Mills, Etlan, Nethers, Haywood, Syria, Banco, Reva, Fordsville, Graves Mill, Aylor, Leon, Wolftown and Hood. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
